NDFP consultant arrested in Cavite - SunStar Philippines
content.desc: A NATIONAL Democratic Front of the Philippines (NDFP) consultant was arrested early Friday, December 7, in Bacoor Cavite, a police official said. Criminal Investigation and Detection Group (CIDG) Director Amador Corpuz identified the arrested NDFP consultant as Rey Claro Casambre, 67. Casambre was nabbed together with his wife, Patricia, 65, executive director of the Philippine Peace Center, while aboard a vehicle along Alm Molino Boulevard, Bacoor, Cavite around 12:10 a.m. Friday, December 7. content.title: Mindanao rights groups wary of Carlito Galvez as OPAPP chief - Rappler
content.desc: DAVAO CITY, Philippines – Human rights groups in Mindanao on Thursday, December 6, expressed concern over the choice of military chief Carlito Galvez Jr as the next presidential peace adviser, and Lieutenant General Benjamin Madrigal Jr as his successor. content.title: CPP announces truce for the holidays, 50th anniversary - CNN Philippines
content.desc: Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 7) — The Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) declared a unilateral ceasefire in observance of the holiday season and its 50th anniversary. The truce will take effect 12:01 a.m. of December 24 to 11:59 p.m. of December 26. Another ceasefire is at 12:01 a.m. of December 31 to 11:59 p.m. of January 1, 2019. content.title: NPA to observe holiday ceasefire; Military says no Somo - SunStar Philippines
content.desc: THE Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP) said Friday, December 7, that it will impose a temporary unilateral ceasefire in its ranks for the Christmas holidays and for its 50th founding anniversary. The Armed Forces of the Philippines (AFP), however, earlier rejected the ceasefire, saying the communist party has not been sincere with the agreement. content.title: Duterte says ‘no longer ready’ to hold talks with Reds - ABS CBN News
content.desc: ABS CBN News MANILA - President Rodrigo Duterte on Wednesday said he is “no longer ready” to talk peace with communist rebels, his latest pronouncement in his series of flip-flops about the peace talks. He said communist rebels should instead just drop their guns and discuss returning to the fold of the law. “Rebels should drop the gun and we will talk. content.title: MisOr governor to respect possible martial law extension - SunStar Philippines
content.desc: MISAMIS Oriental Governor Yevgeny Emano was noncommittal on the recommended extension of martial law in Mindanao, but said he will abide by the decision of President Rodrigo Duterte and the Congress. "I will leave it to the Senate and Congress,” Emano said. State security forces have supposedly gotten a favorable response from local officials and residents when they reportedly made the rounds across the island to get their opinion on the recommendation to prolong martial rule. content.title: Church leader believes peace talks in peril after Dureza’s resignation - SunStar Philippines
content.desc: NOW that Jesus Dureza is no longer the government’s chief peace adviser, a church leader is worried that the peace negotiations will take a wrong turn and the efforts that all stakeholders have been working hard for will be undermined. Sowing the Seeds of Peace main convener and Iglesia Filipina Independiente (IFI) Bishop Felixberto Calang said Dureza was instrumental in sustaining the peace talks that reached the fifth round and that his resignation was a loss to the people behind the negotiations. content.desc: Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, December 4) — Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana said Tuesday he believes that former Bayan Muna Rep. Satur Ocampo and ACT Teachers Rep.
